title: Rio de Janeiro
info: Famous for its Carnival festival.

title: São Paulo
info: Largest city in Brazil.

title: Brasília
info: Capital of Brazil since 1960.

title: Salvador
info: Known for its Portuguese colonial architecture.

title: Fortaleza
info: Has one of the largest Carnival celebrations in Brazil.

title: Belo Horizonte
info: First modern Brazilian city to be planned and built.

title: Manaus
info: Gateway to the Amazon Rainforest.

title: Curitiba
info: Known for its innovative urban planning.

title: Recife
info: Called the 'Venice of Brazil' for its many rivers and bridges.

title: Porto Alegre
info: Famous for its rich cultural life and Gaucho traditions.

title: Goiânia
info: One of the best-planned cities in Brazil.

title: Belém
info: Known for its colonial architecture and the Círio de Nazaré festival.

title: Cuiabá
info: Gateway to the Pantanal, the world's largest tropical wetland.

title: Natal
info: Known for its beautiful beaches and sand dunes.

title: Teresina
info: Only inland capital in the Brazilian Northeast.

title: João Pessoa
info: Easternmost city in the Americas.

title: Maceió
info: Known for its clear water beaches.

title: Aracaju
info: Considered one of the best cities to live in Brazil.

title: Palmas
info: Youngest state capital in Brazil, founded in 1989.

title: Macapá
info: Located right on the Equator.

title: Rio Branco
info: Largest city in the state of Acre.

title: Porto Velho
info: Serves as an important transport hub in the region.

title: São Luís
info: Known for its colonial Portuguese architecture.

title: Boa Vista
info: Only Brazilian capital north of the Equator.

title: Florianópolis
info: Island city known for its beaches and surf spots.

title: Campo Grande
info: Known for its green spaces and parks.

title: Vitória
info: Located on a small island within a bay.
